publications.name: Strongly Bound Dibaryon with Maximal Beauty Flavor from Lattice QCD
publications.summary: First-principles lattice QCD calculation showing a deeply bound dibaryon composed entirely of bottom quarks, with large binding energy and evidence for a pole in the scattering amplitude. The result highlights strong interaction dominance in heavy multibaryon systems.

publications.name: Nuclear correlation functions using first-principle calculations of lattice quantum chromodynamics
publications.summary: Introduced novel computational methods, including redundancy-reduction and machine learning-inspired tensor contraction frameworks, to compute correlation functions for light nuclei with significantly improved efficiency.

publications.name: Precise study of triply charmed baryons (Ωccc)
publications.summary: Performed high-precision lattice QCD calculation of the Ωccc(3/2±) baryons using multiple ensembles and actions, leading to the most accurate mass predictions to date and guiding future experimental searches.

publications.name: Estimating energy levels from lattice QCD correlation functions using a transfer matrix formalism
publications.summary: Developed a transfer matrix-based method to extract hadron and nuclear spectra from lattice QCD correlation functions, improving reliability and computational ease over conventional approaches.

publications.name: Towards the HEFT-hedron: the complete set of positivity constraints at NLO
publications.summary: Derived the full set of next-to-leading order positivity bounds on the Higgs Effective Field Theory, dramatically constraining the allowed space of Wilson coefficients for longitudinal gauge-Higgs scattering processes.
